intro: Schizopsis fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered schizopsis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the family. Schizopsis fasciculata is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks. Its foliage is aromatic and has been used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
